title: Nominees announced for Telegraph Woman of Steel, with the winner to be revealed at the Betfred Super League Awards Night
text:
The top three teams in the Betfred Women’s Super League table each have a player in the running for this year’s Telegraph Woman of Steel.

The winner will be announced at the Betfred Super League Awards Night at the Lowry Theatre in Salford on Sunday, five days before the Grand Final, which will be televised on Sky Sports and a first for women's rugby league.

Following a poll from players across all eight BWSL teams, here are the three nominees who have been shortlisted for the accolade.

Courtney Hill (Leeds)

Hill feared she would lose identity after calling time on her career as a professional cricketer in Australia’s Women’s Big Bash, where tennis world No 1 Ash Barty was among her Brisbane Heat team-mates. Flying to the other side of the world to be with her partner, she readied herself for a new challenge with Leeds Rhinos at the age of 30 in the inaugural Women’s Super League.

"We’re not paid professionals, but the way the club treats us and the support networks they have, is far beyond what I expected," said Hill, who has scored more than 150 points from 14 games this season, including a stunning 60-metre solo try which helped the Rhinos secure a successive Challenge Cup final in July.
